summary: Analyzed FMP-internal vs general validity. The two notions differ in quantification domain - FMP-internal uses finite MCS-derived structures while general validity quantifies over all TaskModels. The validity bridge is blocked for modal operators due to S5-style universal history quantification. Phase 1's FMPSemanticConsequence approach is correctly designed and can be implemented sorry-free.

artifacts.summary: Detailed analysis comparing FMP-internal (SemanticWorldState) vs general (TaskModel) validity, explaining why the validity bridge is blocked for modal operators, and confirming Phase 1's design is correct
